name: React Aria Components
description: React Aria is a library of unstyled React components and hooks that helps you build accessible, high quality UI components for your application or design system.

components.name: Autocomplete
components.definition: An autocomplete combines a TextField or SearchField with a Menu or ListBox, allowing users to search or filter a list of suggestions.

components.name: Breadcrumbs
components.definition: Breadcrumbs display a hierarchy of links to the current page or resource in an application.

components.name: Button
components.definition: A button allows a user to perform an action, with mouse, touch, and keyboard interactions.

components.name: Calendar
components.definition: A calendar displays one or more date grids and allows users to select a single date.

components.name: Checkbox
components.definition: A checkbox allows a user to select multiple items from a list of individual items, or to mark one individual item as selected.

components.name: CheckboxGroup
components.definition: A checkbox group allows a user to select multiple items from a list of options.

components.name: ColorArea
components.definition: A color area allows users to adjust two channels of an RGB, HSL or HSB color value against a two-dimensional gradient background.

components.name: ColorField
components.definition: A color field allows users to edit a hex color or individual color channel value.

components.name: ColorPicker
components.definition: A ColorPicker synchronizes a color value between multiple React Aria color components. It simplifies building color pickers with customizable layouts via composition.

components.name: ColorSlider
components.definition: A color slider allows users to adjust an individual channel of a color value.

components.name: ColorSwatch
components.definition: A ColorSwatch displays a preview of a selected color.

components.name: ColorSwatchPicker
components.definition: A ColorSwatchPicker displays a list of color swatches and allows a user to select one of them.

components.name: ColorWheel
components.definition: A color wheel allows users to adjust the hue of an HSL or HSB color value on a circular track.

components.name: ComboBox
components.definition: A combo box combines a text input with a listbox, allowing users to filter a list of options to items matching a query.

components.name: DateField
components.definition: A date field allows users to enter and edit date and time values using a keyboard. Each part of a date value is displayed in an individually editable segment.

components.name: DatePicker
components.definition: A date picker combines a DateField and a Calendar popover to allow users to enter or select a date and time value.

components.name: DateRangePicker
components.definition: A date range picker combines two DateFields and a RangeCalendar popover to allow users to enter or select a date and time range.

components.name: Dialog
components.definition: A dialog is an overlay shown above other content in an application.

components.name: Disclosure
components.definition: A disclosure is a collapsible section of content. It is composed of a a header with a heading and trigger button, and a panel that contains the content.

components.name: DisclosureGroup
components.definition: A DisclosureGroup is a grouping of related disclosures, sometimes called an accordion. It supports both single and multiple expanded items.

components.name: DropZone
components.definition: A drop zone is an area into which one or multiple objects can be dragged and dropped.

components.name: FileTrigger
components.definition: A FileTrigger allows a user to access the file system with any pressable React Aria or React Spectrum component, or custom components built with usePress.

components.name: Form
components.definition: A form is a group of inputs that allows users to submit data to a server, with support for providing field validation errors.

components.name: GridList
components.definition: A grid list displays a list of interactive items, with support for keyboard navigation, single or multiple selection, and row actions.

components.name: Group
components.definition: A group represents a set of related UI controls, and supports interactive states for styling.

components.name: Link
components.definition: A link allows a user to navigate to another page or resource within a web page or application.

components.name: ListBox
components.definition: A listbox displays a list of options and allows a user to select one or more of them.

components.name: Menu
components.definition: A menu displays a list of actions or options that a user can choose.

components.name: Meter
components.definition: A meter represents a quantity within a known range, or a fractional value.

components.name: Modal
components.definition: A modal is an overlay element which blocks interaction with elements outside it.

components.name: NumberField
components.definition: A number field allows a user to enter a number, and increment or decrement the value using stepper buttons.

components.name: Popover
components.definition: A popover is an overlay element positioned relative to a trigger.

components.name: ProgressBar
components.definition: Progress bars show either determinate or indeterminate progress of an operation over time.

components.name: RadioGroup
components.definition: A radio group allows a user to select a single item from a list of mutually exclusive options.

components.name: RangeCalendar
components.definition: A range calendar displays one or more date grids and allows users to select a contiguous range of dates.

components.name: SearchField
components.definition: A search field allows a user to enter and clear a search query.

components.name: Select
components.definition: A select displays a collapsible list of options and allows a user to select one of them.

components.name: Slider
components.definition: A slider allows a user to select one or more values within a range.

components.name: Switch
components.definition: A switch allows a user to turn a setting on or off.

components.name: Table
components.definition: A table displays data in rows and columns, with support for features like sorting, selection, infinite scrolling, and more.

components.name: Tabs
components.definition: Tabs organize content into multiple sections and allow users to navigate between them.

components.name: TagGroup
components.definition: A tag group is a focusable list of labels, categories, keywords, filters, or other items, with support for keyboard navigation, selection, and removal.

components.name: TextField
components.definition: A text field allows a user to enter a plain text value with a keyboard.

components.name: TimeField
components.definition: A time field allows users to enter and edit time values using a keyboard. Each part of a time value is displayed in an individually editable segment.

components.name: Toast
components.definition: A ToastRegion displays one or more toast notifications.

components.name: ToggleButton
components.definition: A toggle button allows a user to toggle a selection on or off, for example switching between two states or modes.

components.name: ToggleButtonGroup
components.definition: A toggle button group allows a user to toggle multiple options, with single or multiple selection.

components.name: Toolbar
components.definition: A toolbar is a container for a set of interactive controls, such as buttons, dropdown menus, or checkboxes, with arrow key navigation.

components.name: Tooltip
components.definition: TooltipTrigger wraps around a trigger element and a Tooltip. It handles opening and closing the Tooltip when the user hovers over or focuses the trigger, and positioning the Tooltip relative to the trigger.

components.name: Tree
components.definition: A tree displays a hierarchical list of items which may be nested and supports actions on items, and expanding and collapsing of branches.

components.name: Virtualizer
components.definition: A Virtualizer renders a scrollable collection of data using customizable layouts. It supports very large collections by only rendering visible items to the DOM, reusing them as the user scrolls.
